meanings.sent1: The fire incinerates the paper quickly.
meanings.sent2: The incinerator efficiently incinerates all the waste.
meanings.sent3: The dragon incinerates the marshmallows for its s'mores.
meanings.sent4: The intense heat of the sun incinerates any hope of a cool breeze.
meanings.sent5: The volcanic eruption incinerates everything in its path.

meanings.definition: To destroy something by burning it
meanings.sent1: The wildfire incinerates the forest, leaving only ashes behind.
meanings.sent2: The arsonist intentionally incinerates evidence of the crime.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally incinerates the dish, turning it into charcoal.
meanings.sent4: The anger in his eyes seems to incinerate any doubts of his determination.
meanings.sent5: The explosion incinerates the building, sending debris flying everywhere.
